text: Radioville is an unincorporated community in Cass Township, Pulaski County, in the U.S. state of Indiana. ==History== Radioville was named for a local amateur radio enthusiast. For many years, the cultural center of Radioville and environs was a popular bowling alley and restaurant, known as Countryside Lanes, operated by local resident Bud Schroeder for over 40 years, from the early 1960s until his death in 2007. ==Geography== Radioville is located at . ==References== Category:Unincorporated communities in Pulaski County, Indiana Category:Unincorporated communities in Indiana
title: Radioville, Indiana
